There was so much to try! - the trout dip was first and perfectly paired with corn chips and baked toasts. - then came the crab cakes- delicious and very meaty! - the corn was good but it was my least favorite...- the salmon was delicious, could definitely taste the woody cedar flavor in the fish! - the steak was the piece of resistance! Medium cooked and generous portions! Yuuuuummmmmm- the fries could have been a little crispier - the sliders were paired with the onion ring. Yummy! - dessert was warm chocolate brownies and we all left with bags of homemade cookies!! The event was amazing! Thank you so much to Ted for hosting such a magnificent and generous table for us! I am a big fan :)

Here's the deal: On a whim I  tried this place for a lunch meeting.It has the typical steak house feel inside. They have a nice bar & "hi top" section as well. They have a variety of usual steak house options... and a list of burgers which could be either beef or bison.  I tried a bison burger and it was very good! good portion and flavorful!!  Our service was very friendly and attentive!  Would definitely try it again!

Walked by this place as we were looking for another restaurant.. It looked inviting so we gave it a try. SO glad we did! Absolutely delicious!! I ordered the veggie burger and it was the best I've ever had!!! My husband ordered the cheeseburger and loved it. Service was phenomenal, restaurant is CLEAN, roomy, and fairly quiet for a NYC restaurant. We're both from the west where a 10  foot booth for two people is very common, so getting used to the elbow to elbow dining spaces on the east coast has been a bit of an adjustment. They have so much room here! Our booth was huge, we were seated right away, and water/drinks were brought within a minute of sitting down. We're going back again this week!

I would give Ted's a 3.5, based on my experience last night. I have dined at a few TMG's, and they are all excellent in respect to attentive staff, and fresh food. The drawback last night was twofold: unseasoned (supposedly spicy) appetizers - and they were bland, no two ways about it. Secondly, I had a steak salad in which the steak was a pitiful cut - it was rare, and you needed a table saw to cut through it.  I did, however, have a bite of my companions steak...it was phenomenal.   SO, that being said, I think I just got a bad dish. I chose not to send it back, and did enjoy the remainder of the salad, aside from the steak.

I came here for a Yelp elite event, was extremely pleased with my experience. The atmosphere has Western vibes. Or rather, the American Great Plains. The restaurant is located in an expansive room with a bison head mounted on one of the walls.For the Yelp event, we were offered a tasting menu with highlights from Ted's. Every menu item was quite good. My personal favorite was the crab cakes, which had generous amounts of crab meat. Also, the hamburger and bison filet were delicious. Or perhaps it was a bison burger and meat filet. I couldn't tell the difference, but both were very good.I also got to sample some Sangria from their bar. It was quite good, and the maitre d' told us that all of their juices/mixes are pressed in-house. They have a Happy Hour from 5-7pm on weeknights that with $5 martinis. Given the neighbrhood, this is a steal.I'd recommend coming here if you want an atypical steakhouse experience.

Here for an elite event recently and the place blew me away for the most part. The servers were very attentive and very very nice. The place is huge and gorgeous. The restrooms are the size of bedrooms. The food being served in small portions for our huge elite party was still very generous. I had crabcake with guac, that was amazing. They had a burger it tasted like beef but coulda been bison or are they the considered same thing? Anywhoo that came with an American flag and a huge onion ring on top. The burger was great the onion ring was too deeply fried. They also served fillet steak that was cooked perfectly, but I do like a bit more seasoning on it or have it come with a sauce. Salmon was average as it was overly dry but the mod mayo sauce thing they had was very good. I mean if you're making a 100 pieces of salmon it will probably not result in the best effort but they still did a decent job. Finally they gave us a ton of dessert, cookies (best snickerdoodle lemon flavored cookie ever) and ice cream over brownies...Also their house wines were great. They also gave us bottomless sangria which objectively is probably top 3 best sangria I have had in the city.

Love this place!  I used to work at NBC and would eat at Ted's pretty frequently. Now that I have no reason to be in that area, I kinda forgot about it. I was lucky enough to attend a Yelp event at Ted's this week and got a reminder how great it is. Everything is super fresh and made on site. No processed foods at Ted's! They have a great variety on the menu and everything I've tried has been amazing. My fav is the steak with the bison burger being a close runner up. The sides are all great too. They have a great happy hour and lots of yummy cocktail options. Even their cocktail mixers are fresh and made on-site! I definitely see more trips to Ted's in my future. I hate the commotion of the area where Ted's is located, but the amazing food you get there makes it all worth it! Oh yeah, the prices aren't too bad here either! Definitely way more affordable that the other steakhouses in the area. Great value for the quality of food!

This review is based on attending a Yelp event at Ted's Montana Grill where we got the opportunity to sample a selection of their food and drinks.  Bison has long been something I wanted to try and although it is a red meat very similar to beef, there is a subtle flavour difference (probably due to the reduced fat content of bison meat).  Let me tell you, "Ted's filet" did not disappoint!  The bison sample was delicious and perfectly cooked for my taste.  To me, the filet was the highlight but we also sampled: * "St Phillips Island Crab Cakes with avocado" (generous amounts of crab)* "Southwest corn" (although not something I would normally have it was very good and spicy without being over the top)* "Bar None Sliders" (beef and bison burger in a "biscuit" bun - we ended up in a long semantic debate about scone vs biscuit vs cookie but as the weird foreigner, I really had no chance ;) )  The sliders were excellent although the "salt and pepper onion rings" were not really my thing as I'm not a huge fan of deep fried crumbed stuff* "Cedar Plank Salmon"  Noticeable cedar flavour, which worked very well with the salmon* Brownies (which I generously helped others finish).  Had it not been for the bison filet, this may have been my favourite...They also had red and white sangria, plus wines and fresh squeezed lemonade.  I drank the "Bison Ridge Cabernet Sauvignon", which paired well with the bison in more than just name.All in all, a very enjoyable evening with excellent food and extremely friendly staff.  Granted it was an organised event but I would definitely return for a pre-show meal, especially the three course "Theatre Menu", which seems a reasonable price for Manhattan.

Great midtown spot for lunch, dinner, or a after work drink. It's not just a steak house. Wonderful service and plenty of room for a party or a casual meal. Came here for lunch and had the bison beef sliders which were on a wonderful fluffy biscuit. Great way to have a burger. Also had it with fries which were fresh cut and fried up perfectly. The crab cake was great too. Meaty chunks of crab with little breading. I'd be back.

This place definitely exceeded my expectations. I came here last night to attend a Yelp event so I was lucky enough to be served a variety of food options. For apps, I would definitely recommend the crab cakes which come with a guacamole and kale salad - something different and such a great pairing. The bar none sliders were perfectly cooked and served on a moist biscuit like bun instead of the standard dry white bread buns. For dinner entrees, we sampled the cedar plank salmon and the Ted's Fillet. Both were great but I would definitely recommend the steak over the salmon (it is a steakhouse after all) as its very tender and was perfectly cooked. The restaurant has the feel of a typical steakhouse inside with a spacious dinning room and a large bar area with additional seating. Even with our large party, the wait staff was friendly and I could tell they were rushing around as quickly as possible to make sure that we were all taken care of (they did forget my water but made sure I had plenty of wine so I will forgive them).I hear that they also have a decent happy hour at the bar so that's always an excuse to pop in and check this place out.

Came here yesterday for an Elite events and was really impressed. During the event, the waitresses brought around 6 different menu item samples so everyone could get a good idea of the whole menu. I have to say, everything I tried was great, but the bison burger was PHENOMENAL. The drinks were also great- I recommend the white sangria, or the fresh squeezed lemonade for a non-alcoholic option. Both drinks were from a truly fresh batch so they tasted great!The waitstaff was also really nice and accommodating. The manager of the restaurant even came out and told the whole group the history of the restaurant and its founders, which I thought was a nice touch.All in all, Ted's is a great casual place with phenomenal food and drinks. Perfect for groups or a date, especially since it's in such a central location. I'll be back for a full meal!

What a great find! Came to New York to see Book of Mormon with my boyfriend and stopped in here to eat. Super location close to everything. Had a bison burger for the first time. Amazing! So juicy and flavorful. And the staff was so accommodating and friendly. We will definitely be back! Highly recommend!

When you see the three dollar signs next to the name one envisions the culinary delight that awaits. In reality this is just a burger joint with white table cloths. While the food was edible it was unimaginative and not unlike what one would expect at a much lower price point.

The food quality is exceptional. Regardless of it being a franchise it is very well run; thus, delivering a great experience. I cant speak for the consistency of their quality as numerous of my friends where complaining about previous experiences. I had the Bison ribeye and it was cooked just as i had ordered it. The steak was delicious l. I would definitely recommend going here once. Service is lacking, the people interrupt conversations to ask simple questions.

Be sure to read the calorie counts on the menu at this Steak House poseur.  The onion ring appetizer is 1,150 calories, the most I usually eat in a whole dinner!  We ordered grilled shrimp as an appetizer to escape calories, but Ted's would have none of that.  The shrimp were accompanied by deep fried melted cheese bread which probably had 500 calories without the shrimp.  Although the shrimp were great naked, Ted's includes mayonnaise to increase your odds of a heart attack before dessert.The burger I ordered was sat on a soggy bun, and was covered with tasteless avocado.  How they accomplished that is a mystery.  My dinner mate had a great steak, but for a supposedly moderately priced restaurant, you apparently have to order a $30.00 steak to enjoy your meal.

Saw the spring spectacular and had no idea where to eat.. Found Ted's on Yelp.. Great place, great food and the location was even better! Not even a four minute walk... Had the grilled chicken over salad .. My sister had the teds filet and my mom had the salmon.. All delish!!

Stopped in for a cocktail before our show...just in time for HH. To bad we weren't hungry! It looked great! The Margaritas were recommended to us so that's what we had...now that's my recommendation to you! Cheers!

What a wonderful dinner I enjoyed here! I found it through Yelp when searching restaurants near Radio City Music Hall, the place is just across the street!The staff was extremely friendly, our appetizers were delicious:Smoked trout dipBison NachosOnion RingsOur drinks were very good, dinner was extremely ample, I couldn't finish mine. I felt the salmon on my salad was a bit salty for my taste, but enjoyable. The place is very environmentally friendly from the paper-like straws to the powder hand washing soap in the bathrooms. Enjoy!

Good place for group lunch and it was packed on Wed!  We came here with a group of 14 co-workers, and were seated immediately (well, we did have a reservation).  We ordered the smoked trout appetizers, it was very good.  I went with a bison cheeseburger, it was terrific, leaner than cow meat, but packed a nice flavor.  A few co-workers had bison fillet mignons and raved about them.  The price point is very fair.  Usually, in a steakhouse, you have to pay separately for the sides, here, the steaks come with two sides of your choice.  The milkshakes were the bomb!

I'm surprised to see good reviews of Ted's Montana Grill's New York City location. What began as a hearty, fun eatery has in the past two years become a rude, officious, poorly-staffed, and low service restaurant through what appears to be mismanagement. The host's vagaries appear to determine whether incomplete parties will be seated or not. The host has claimed not to have reservations available which, when checking online, were readily available. When this was escalated to middle management, the representative was shrill, tense, and unhelpful. It's a shame to see Ted Turner's vision turn out this way.

Great place for a good meal after Radio City show.  Not a huge menu but all the basics: steak, burgers, chicken, fish. Reasonably priced for a restaurant in that area.   Try the salt and pepper onion rings.

Great place for lunch--especially if you're going to an event at Radio City Music Hall which is a half block away.  The place is decorated in woody lodge style, all nicely done, friendly atmosphere and staff, and a ton of burgers, fries and other lunchtime staples.  Price friendly, too (by New York standards!).

Came here last night with my mom and sister for a drink and quick bite before a concert. Love the mad bugallo margarita ! Spicy but tasty ! We had the grilled shrimp which were very juicy and also seasoned just right. I also got the crab cake which was one of the best ones I have eaten in a long time ! My sister got the burger which I tried also and the meat was super fresh ! This place is fairly close to my sisters office and a place I will keep in mind anytime I meet up w her !

Great attentive waiters. Excellent food. Oldies song. You should try the bison burger. Oh soo good. My son had the bison meatloaf, mashed potatoes and he said it was just down home comfort food. Really enjoyed our dinner.

I'm super picky & don't like a lot of restaurants but I liked this one. Im vegetarian so a steakhouse is not my typical choice but I am traveling & was trying to find a place good for more than just me. I got the veggie burger & it was delicious. My father got the T-bone steak & he very much enjoyed it as well. The service was good, the food came out fast & getting a reservation was easy (though I would suggest a reservation for pre-theatre/weekends). The prices were as expected for NYC/theater district. Overall, we were very happy.

I live around the corner from this place.  It is reasonably priced for the area and I walked right in with no wait time.  It is a good burger place.  I had the bison burger which was very good.  We had many drinks as well ... They have a good selection of beer and wine as well.

I have been to Ted's a few times and I'm never disappointed in the food or quality of service. Hands down, the best steak I've had in the city. The fries, onion rings and nachos are awesome bar foods as well. The wait staff are attentive and don't make you feel like you're taking too long. The only thing is that there are two entrances--one from outside and one from the inside of the Time Life building, which I use more often because I have business to conduct there, but going in that way, you'll be overlooked and the waiters don't seem to know what to do with you. I don't know what's going on there. Maybe they should just close that entrance.

Ordered the bison ribs and onion rings. The onion rings were awesome! Lightly battered and crispy. The same can't be said for the bison ribs. When the dish came out I thought they had brought an appetizer. Only three ribs and the fries took up more of the plate than the ribs. Ok so I thought the ribs better be pretty amazing for so few. Unfortunately they were just ok. Flavor on the BBQ sauce was decent but nothing spectacular. I guess I should have tried the steak, but when you have bison as a main selling point it should be on point. Next time I'll skip it and order a steak.

I came here with my family on Saturday to grab a quick bite before we went to see the play Fish Out Of Water (great play if you are interested). We first started with the homemade pickles that are brought out instead of bread. What a great idea and they were delicious - just the great amount of sweet and sour. And you can tell that they were freshly made - they had a great crisp to them.We then all ordered burgers and fries. I had the Cadillac burger - BBQ sauce, ranch dressing, bacon, and onion straws. It was delicious. And the fries were also really good - crispy and salty - my two favorite things when it comes to fries. Warning - the menu has the calories on it so make sure you are prepared. Sometimes it's better to just not know...

Here for a convention, so finding a place where everyone would be happy is not easy, and it's usually left up to me. We were walking, so close to the HIlton Mid-town was important, esp as it was bitterly cold. Since last year, the restaurant that we would have gone to was closed (same place, I think), so after looking at the menu, I had the concierge make reservations for 5. It was a quick walk over and nice and warm and welcoming when we got there. Whether it was because it was a Sunday night or everyone was at either the SNL celebration or the NBA All-Star game, they weren't very busy, so we were seated right away. Nice open space and everyone wasn't crammed together. Lots of room at our table of 5 so we didn't put our elbows in each others space, but were able to talk and enjoy comfortably.The wine, liquor and beer selections were plentiful enough that we all were able to settle on something. There are even two Adult milkshakes on the menu, one with Jack Daniels, that sounded intriguing. The specials consisted of a Bison Strip Steak, like a Delmonico at 16ozs, fresh grouper and something else that I can't remember. The offering gave and option many times of beef vs. bison. I like bison, so this really made me happy. Around the table we had the 16oz Bison steak with roasted mushrooms and a side of garlic smashed potatoes, medium rare and huge! I didn't realize how hungry I was and had planned on having cold steak for breakfast. That didn't happen. It was tender,juicy, great tasting and cooked to perfection. I don't feel in the least bit guilty eating it all. (Note: I had been up since 5am, shoveling and then driving to the city in nasty weather and had't had anything but coffee and a bagel all day).Hubby ordered the No. 11 burger- slow braised bison with horseradish cheddar, mushrooms and horseradish sauce. I stole a bit and it was very good- not at all dry and nice and thick.Also ordered were the planked salmon, steak salad and another burger. No one had any complaints and I was told it was a good choice by everyone. None of us had any room for dessert.For my husband and I, two beers, the steak and burger, with a side of mashed potatoes was $89 including tax. For NYC, I don't consider this much different that what we do spend and it was worth it. I highly recommend it.

I went here for my Valentine's Day dinner and I was pleasantly surprised. The bison nachos appetizer will melt in your mouth and the jalapeno peppers that came with it added some real kick. My bison ribeye was tender and juicy. The asparagus side was well cooked. My girlfriend's steak friites entree was well seasoned and mouth watering. What I truly like is that Ted's doesn't have a big menu. They specialize in serving beef and bison offerings, but salmon and chicken are available for those who aren't in the mood for red meat. The restaurant is spacious and the service is top notch. The food is reasonably priced compared to other steakhouses.

Came a few weeks ago with friends to celebrate a friend's birthday. Although this is not a current review, I am pretty sure that the quality of the place has not changed much. We were 7 people. We ordered a variety of dishes all of those they were perfectly cooked. Especially steaks were very tender.Apple crisp dessert was huge and delicious., as was cheesecake.Our server was very friendly and attentive.  Price very reasonable for Manhattan.I would definitely recommend.

Came here for a business lunch with a large group around 10 people. The crab cake I got as appetizer and the salmon entree were both quite good. Many others who got burgers seemed quite happy with their food too.We also got bison nachos to share. The price point for this type of food is fair- pretty good value for this neighborhood. (There are just way too many "fancy" places with bad food here!) at least this place is classy! The service is very efficient too. Recommend Ted's for a business meal with large group!

A white tablecloth and napkin type atmosphere that is dark and warm without feeling stuffy. The Happy Hour bar scene is thriving, so for an early dinner the dining room is basically empty and service is quick, so this is a great option for a before theater dinner.Most of the beers on tap are pretty standard, but we did enjoy the Sam Adams Cold Snap.  Our server was friendly and attentive.We had the Salt & Pepper Onion rings, noted on the appetizer menu, along with our burgers and they were probably the best onion rings I've ever had. The were crispy, not at all greasy and they provided the perfect bite.  No breading falling off or onion pulling out.  Served with a creamy horseradish sauce, they were truly excellent.As for the burgers we opted for bison meat which was high quality, but a bit more gamy than bison I've had at another burger place.  The Bacon Cheeseburger included crispy bacon and grilled onions.  The No. 11 is a burger topped with braised bison, cheddar and mushrooms.  The burgers are quite hearty and fulfill any burger craving in a strong way.  The fries are excellent, crispy and tender and you can tell they are real fresh-cut fries.It's not a cheap burger spot, but you get a great burger and a satisfying meal.

I came here last night, as my boyfriend requested a steakhouse for his birthday dinner. The place was his choice.  I had never even heard of it, nor had anyone else I mentioned it to, but I'm glad it's such a secret! It wasn't crowded at all, even though I had made a reservation, but granted it was a Tuesday. There were only a handful of tables, most of them appeared to be business dinners. Upon sitting, we were greeted by our waitress, water and a bowl of half-sour pickles. I'm partial to sour, but these we're yummy and had a nice crunch. We ordered a bottle of red wine, and sat for a bit and enjoyed it. My boyfriend ordered the bison ribeye and I went for the bison short ribs, as I'm not a steak-eater. He had never had a bison steak, but honestly said he couldn't tell the difference. Saves you a couple hundred calories though! We were both VERY happy with our meals! The short ribs fell off the bone and I didn't even need a knife to cut them. Everything was perfectly cooked, as ordered, which was excellent. We slowly enjoyed our meals, enjoying the calm, quiet of the restaurant. I think this place is a great option for a very nice meal, especially for steak lovers who want to try something new!

We came here with a large group that included 4 children and 5 adults who just survived the chaos at American Girl.  Although we did not have a reservation, it was early on New Year's Day when everyone was sleeping in, so the place had only a few customers.  We only had to wait for them to pull tables together for our large party.  Pickles are served immediately which pleased my husband.  He is the guy who will visit our local farmers' market weekly in Red Bank, NJ for his 2-Tub supply.  I think our table did ask for another round before we ordered our appetizers and meals.The menu is a vegetarian's nightmare.  All beef and bison dishes.  More diverse burger combinations than at Bobby's Burger Palace.  The adult milkshake offerings caught our eye, but so did the calorie count which was listed on the menu.  We chose to just dream about them.  The waiter patiently answered our menu questions and was attentive throughout the meal.  Service was accommodating that they allowed one of the adults order chicken tenders from the kids' menu because there was no equivalent offering from the adult menu. Adult size = double kid price. We ordered a basketful of onion rings and homemade potato chips which came out with house-made ranch dressing and horseradish dressing.  I never got a chance to taste the rings because the kids inhaled them.  The chips were OK, but I have had better from the plethora of Portuguese places in Newark.I chose to get a naked burger with avocado, tomato and roasted Brussel sprouts (with bacon!) which was the veggie of the day.  The burger could use some seasoning but otherwise fine to satiate me. My daughter had the sliders which she finished all three.  They had to be good because she usually brings  leftovers home.  My husband enjoyed his bison burger.  He also had their tortilla soup which he also said was good. We had no room for dessert.  We would go again if we are visiting this part of the city.

Great burger place in midtown.  I love how they start with pickles on the table, great touch and taste so fresh!They have a choice of beef and bison burgers, don't be turned off with bison.  Try it, you will not be disapointed! Literally melts in your mouth!Can get crowded especially during lunch hours, yiu can make a reservation!

Went here for am office lunch. It was ok. Certainly affordable for its location. Service left much to be desired. Had the Delmonico rib eye, was decent. Not sure if I'll return, certainly not excited to.
Teds Montana Grill was very close and convenient to eat at for a late night dinner near Rockefeller Center. The Burger was awesome but the bison nachos really stole the show.
Great service even if it is tight quarters.  They have a kids menu which is so helpful when traveling w small children.  Would recommend the filet, husband enjoyed the bison ribeye steak.

On a nice trip to NYC with my fiancé and a few friends we decided to eat at Teds when the original place that we wanted to eat was packed. Upon entering we were seated and saw the menu and everything seemed interesting, they had bison on the menu which intrigued us. And they put pickles down on the table which was an awesome treat.We ordered various things and was satisfied with the meals. There were unfortunately only a couple things that made the experience less than perfect. 1) the waitress took a while to approach us. 2) there are no refills on the $3 soda which is in maybe a 10oz glass. 3) the drink that was a simple rum and coke was $12.50. 4) overheard a few off comments by waitstaff. Most of that is minor and it was good food and I would go back again to experience more of their menu. It is worth a trip.
The food was good... Service just fair. Serves my coffee with a tablespoon and it was old! The bathrooms were disgusting!! If I had gone into the bathroom before we are ate we would have left.

Happy hour and light bites review:Popped in for some happy hour action before heading to Radio City Music Hall for the Christmas Spectacular and it was pretty much a fine experience, nothing crazy.I went with the $7 fancified boozy Arnold Palmer - although it really wasn't boozy. I had two and in most cases after two drinks, I'm raring to go however, I left feeling nothing. Booo. Tipsy YoSteph is a much more fun YoSteph.The bison nachos were disappointing. I know buffalo may have been extinct at one time, but I thought they were back in business; apparently not on these nachos. The cheese, the small amount that were on the chips, was barely melted and all other toppings (think some tomatoes and jalapeños) were sparse. Overall, these were some pretty pathetic nachos and nachos are pretty much the easiest thing to make. The fried green beans were delicious, so I'd suggest those.Overall, if you're desperate for somewhat affordable fare in the neighborhood, I'd say be hesitant but come by, but maybe stick to the burgers. Ambiance is nice and the staff was pleasant, but overall food and value just wasn't up to snuff. I'd rather of spent a little bit more and enjoyed everything and left with a buzz!

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Not only great food and service, but they are all about sustainability, recycling, and support the American bison herd.I've had the Bison burgers, the Bison Filets, and the roasted Brussels sprouts and fries. The burgers are the best in the city that I've had by far. There's only one other restaurant that comes close to the quality. The fries are quite good. It isn't cheap, but in midtown, it's priced correctly and is quality meat.The filet was a good size cut and was priced well. Loved the Brussel sprouts which were flavored and roasted well. Had a few mixed drinks and they were done just right. All in all, the temperature is always right and the service is exemplary. I've been to this location 4 times. The staff is always fun to talk to and have genuine conversations.It does get busy here at lunch, so keep that in mind. For an upscale steakhouse that does sustainability and game meats in midtown, it's priced quite well.

My brother and i went here lat week, we had the nachos with bison chili, my bro had bison short rib and i had roast chicken with mashed potato with cranberry glaze sauce.The atmosphere was really nice and cozyFood was good.. Service was ok... no complaints..Will bring my husband here next time..

Mediocre at best. The signature Teds filet was about the size of a large postage stamp, and tasted ok,just ok.The service was on par with Walmart.  When I complained, the waiter disappeared never to return.I had to get up several times for ice, salt and pepper and finally the check.I requested to speak to the manager or the owner, as was ignored.Overall: pathetic

Great place for lunch or dinner. We needed a place to grab lunch after a Radio City Music Hall Rockettes show.  Even though Open Table had no reservations during the time we wanted, we walked up and our party of 6 was taken at the time we needed. Leaving Radio City, you are able to stay in the concourse tunnel to arrive at the location. Try the bison burger and fries!  Great flavor and cooked to perfection.  We had an awesome experience. Give it a try.
For being in a very touristy location the food was good and the service was friendly. No complaints here.

If you wanna get some good steak and are in midtown Ted's will definitely hit the spot. Came here twice for a corporate dinner, had the NY strip (bison). Both my visits had great waiting service, with a clean and quite environment. Do get dessert, I recommend the cheese cake.

didn't have a reservation so had about a 20 minute wait which was not too bad...place is really hopping around lunch time...ordered sliders and chips for appetizers....then for meals steaks and salmon were the choices...all were very good....service was also very good although they did bring our appetizers to the table next to us....also, they have a pretty decent gluten free menu and take special care for those allergic to gluten....will definitely be back when back in the city...but with a reservation...
Very bad service and food quality not great. Paid 32$ for a steak which was the equivalent to a Denny's steak.

BLACKBERRY JAM BURGER. Don't knock it until you've tried it!This masterpiece comes with your choice of beef or bison, BACON (one of the most important components), cheddar cheese, jalapeños, blackberry jam, and wait for it........A FRIED EGG! Everything just works really well with each other.I've been here a couple of times for happy hour, which is kind of lackluster (their only specials are Yuenglings and bad margaritas). But I may start coming back just for that burger! Seriously, you need to try it! I think I devoured that thing in less than 5 minutes. That's how good it was. (either that or maybe I'm just disgusting).
Great post-NYC Marathon meal!  Burgers were great, server was attentive. Beer selection was not listed on menu, but turned out to be ok once I asked.  Would come back.

Been to Ted's twice - once for lunch, once for dinner. The burger I had at lunch - bison with jalapeño and cheese - was fantastic, definitely worth a second visit. Plus, the place was vibrant and crowded.When I went back for dinner, it wasn't as good - place was dead (1 of maybe 4 tables) and the food was, well, mediocre at best. I know they're known for certain things, but they should be able to do all things well, especially a simple piece of salmon. It's was overcooked (most places ask how you'd like it cooked) and just bland. The veggies with it weren't much better. My girlfriend ordered a chicken sandwich, but it was just ok. Service was decent - not overly attentive, but she didn't ignore us either. Would go back ... for lunch.
Order their theatre menu between 4-7 pm.  It's to die for and only cost 30 usd for a 3 course menu

Surprised to find this place almost empty on a Saturday night in NYC.  But got a nice booth.  Have been to a few Teds across the U.S. and this was very similar.  The bison ribeye was excellent.  Others in our group of 4 had good bison burgers and beef burgers.  Service was good not great.  Wine did not show up until after the food with excuse that they were busy.....unlikely with NO one in the place.  Broccoli was cold for one of us but promptly replaced and was excelent.  All in all good food and a nice night.  Nothing special.  Still like the food here and would visit  any in the chain.

Ted's Montana Grill overall score: 73My wife and I came in for the "theater menu" deal: $29 for three courses. Not a bad price. Check the verdict below.Flavor: 6My first bite of the beef rib eye was a nine, but it went downhill from there. The steak was nicely cooked and all, but the meat was a bit tough, a bit over-salted and wet. When I say wet, I mean there were small puddles of grease on the top of the steak. Also when I say tough, I mean the grain of the meat was tight and a little difficult to chew. While it did have a decent flavor, I had to drop the score because of these things. There was also a good deal of grizzle on the cut, and a shitload of bleed-out once I got down on it. If it weren't for that and the grizzle I might have scored this a seven.
I had the Bison Filet medium-rare with a loaded baked potato and thought it was great! The bartender was also on point and made sure that I had everything that I needed.
Restaurant was empty, food took almost an hour to get and the waiter rarely came back to the table. Food was good, but I will not be coming back here.
Love this spot! Fantastic happy hour 3-7pm every day & quiet on Sundays if you need a place to drink & think. :)

This place is great for groups. My coworker chose this place for our team lunch, and we actually got a private room (with curtains to block noise from the outside) that can accommodate 8 people (we were a group of 8). The room was big, our table was big enough for 8 big plates and 9 phones!Our server was attentive and came often to check on us, refill our drinks and take away our dishes. The food came in fast. I had the Beef Cheese Burger without bun, and it was great.

Went here for a worktime lunch. Make a reservation, I did and got seated right away but I head the hostess tell another party of a 30 minute wait. The decor was interesting but felt it worked for the vibe of the place. I went for a steak, they have 3 or 4 cuts and each cut you can go with beef or bison. Went with the bison filet since...when in rome. It was very good, first time for a bison steak and was similar to that of the burgers but of higher quality. I would certainly come again...Plus they strive to be green!

OHH me GOD! OHH me GOD! There is a heaven! " Andrea,"  served us at the " PUB' & was SOO, SOO  helpful. We both had the BISON which is " OUT OF THIS WORLDY". It was restaurant week, here in MANHATTAN PROPER, & off we go. It TWAS amazing! Thee ambience was lovely, drinks great, Staff friendly, & did NOT hurry us to finish & leave. . A TRULY great experience & PS. We asked for RARE , which Bison should be cooked at, & guess what! WE GOT RARE!   HOORAY!  Cheers to all, & GO HERE!                ( SIGH)   I love Montana, & I'm from thee UK.

Soup (it was the gumbo that night) was OK. Bison nachos sounded interesting but they too were just OK. Same with the onion rings.The bison short ribs were pretty good (when is braised meat not good?), as was the bison ribeye. Not life-changing, not omg-i-have-to-come-back-because-these-are-so-delicious, but just right in the middle good.Service was painfully slow, but it might have been because they stuck us in a small private room in the back. And it was Restaurant Week. But still... our server never checked up on us, our water glasses were never refilled, and our check took forever to arrive.Overall, right in the middle A-OK (since I will give them the benefit of the doubt re: service): The food just didn't wow me, but it's not like I'll balk at the idea if someone really wanted to eat here with me.
Decent menu, very nice waitress, burger was cooked medium well instead of medium rare.  Nice atmosphere overall.

good food, okay service. nice ambience. not sure what people mean by "touristy," it's quite nice inside. ordered crabcakes with mashed potatoes, pretty good. crabcakes came with guacamole, never tried it with guac before but it was great.
This place is good for what it is, a chain. Expect good prices for decent food. It's nothing to write home about, but it's not supposed to be.

Food was very tasty.  The gruyere burger and bison ribs were flavorful and cooked to perfection.  The cheesecake was absolutely amazing.  Atmosphere was sophisticated, but not too stuffy.  Our party of 8 was given a private room, which was really nice. We would gladly come back!!

Midtown Manhattan isn't know for brunch. However, Ted's Montana Grill on 51st Street is looking to change that. With a newly-launched brunch menu, Ted's is looking to pull some of your traditional Village brunchers up above 42nd street.I was invited to check out Ted's new brunch menu. Ted's Montana Grill is known for two things 1) Ted Turner 2) bison, bison and more bison. On the brunch menu this is evident as your eyes are immediately drawn to the Bison Short Rib Hash, called out in enormous font and dominating the other dishes listed.Some of our brunch highlights:Subtly spicy Bloody Marys were served with a slice of bacon.The Bison Short Rib Hash came served with breakfast potatoes, roasted cornand avocado, topped with fried eggs. Don't let the pictures fool you. There were mounds of melt-in-your-mouth slow-braised short rib bison underneath those eggs that were bursting with flavor. The bison delivered a flavor punch (that's right, flavor punch) directly to my taste buds. This is an unbelievably rich dish.The Crab Cake Benedict consists of St. Phillip's Island crab cakes, wilted spinach,poached eggs and chipotle hollandaise served with breakfast potatoes. For those of you looking to cut some carbs, this Benedict was unique in that the crab cakes served as the English muffins. Hailey had no complaints here, greedily devouring this dish. (I didn't even get any!)Next up, savory corn flapjacks with oven-roasted ham, cheddar cheese and chives, served with honey butter and maple syrup. I was expecting these to be heavy pancakes. What we got were light, fluffy and buttery flapjacks. I was stuffed from my bison hash but somehow I found room to fit these guys. The edges had a buttery crispness to them and I'd highly recommend these for those that aren't into eggs as much.Finally, a boozy mudslide milkshake capped off the brunch. This was made with Baileys, Kahlua and vodka, and filled with huge scoops of ice cream topped with lots of whipped cream. If I had known I would be drinking a milkshake during brunch I would have worn my stretchy pants!The best thing I heard during brunch came from one of the chefs. He told me that they're experimenting in the kitchen to come up with the perfect brunch menu. How are they doing this? By checking out popular brunch spots in the West Village to see what's working. (By the way, this sounds like an awesome part of the job.)The VerdictI'm looking forward to seeing how Ted's menu evolves over the coming months. They're just starting out with brunch and it sounds like the team is committed to making it work. The only critique I have is that compared to other brunch spots, prices are a little steep and drinks aren't included so this may be a brunch to check out when your parents are in town. Regardless, I highly recommend giving Ted's Montana Grill a try - you won't regret it!

Went here for a drink after work, because Capital Grille next door was packed. NYU was having a graduation event at Radio City, which probably caused the rush at   Capital Grille. So-so place --- service was slow, place was half-empty. We only had drinks. The tables in the bar area had big kitchen Morton salt shakers - our table shaker had some ketchup courtesy whoever used the table last. Wouldn't go back here.
I love this place.  I eat here at least once a week.  Bison burgers are awesome. High quality ingredients. Good staff.

For a place that is all about bison, the bison is not that good. The service was okay. I got annoyed with the waiter because he suggest the burger of the day, which was blue cheese & guiere.  It was disgusting.  I could only take about two bites.  And a lovely addition to the okay meal was getting food poisoning after.

Great food and quick service. My cousin and I dine here for lunch from time to time and we love it. The white sangria is to die for. The food is always good. I Love the eco friendly aspect and will be back sooner than later. The one and only thing I dislike is the water. It has a really bad taste. I work down the street and the water at my job isn't that great either. Although it's supposed to be filtered.

Was craving bison recently after seeing the YouTube video of bison running down the street at Yellowstone.Sat at the bar. The bartender was perfect with the service. Unfortunately, they were out of the filet - the reason I came. Ordered a strip instead and enjoyed it. I'd give the steak a 4 out of 5. Modestly priced, ~$30 a steak.Lots of space. It's a really nice interior. Classy. Everything looks brand new, at least in the bar area. Some large TVs at the bar.Definitely will be going back for that filet. And perhaps the Happy Hour.
Decent burger with a heaping pile of sweet potato fries. The waitress was attentive and very helpful navigating through the extensive menu.

I visit NYC often for business and, while there are so many excellent choices for places to dine, Ted's continues to be one of my favorite spots. The bison burgers are out of this world delicious! The wait staff is always friendly. And, I even met Mr. Turner here once. He was very friendly!

Always great food, always FAST and friendly service, and all at a pretty reasonable price for Midtown. I usually get the Madison burger (bison) because I love anything with goat cheese. My boyfriend usually gets thr bacon cheeseburger. I've also gotten the salmon a few times which is also very tasty.

I just had bison burger at Ted's Montana Grill. I had it with cheddar cheese, pickles tomato, salt-and-pepper and had it done medium rare to medium, it was very flavorful.In fact, I thought it was the most flavorful bison burger I've had and I've probably had a couple dozen. Sat at the bar which was very nice. Happens to be a very snowy day in Manhattan so not too crowded, which I like.The french fries, were another story, they came lukewarm. But, they were crunchy which I like. I usually don't eat all of the fries, and in this case, left at least half of them on the plate.If you're looking for a flavorful bison burger and a comfortable place to have lunch in midtown I would highly recommend Ted's Montana Grill.
Slow hostess, slow waiter, quick good tasting food. No other way to describe. I won't return. Place was nearly empty as well.

Yeah, this is like a cool place to eat, but it feels very touristy after a few seconds of sitting down, and doesn't come across as "special". The food was good, the server we had was super nice and attentive. Just overall I think we all look for that "special" spot, that makes us think it's special and fun, not something that probably has a bunch of cousins scattered around the midwest like a Denny's... You won't hate it if you go here, but you probably won't love it either, so it never hurts to try it and say you went...

This is a great intimate restaurant, especially at night time. Great proximity to Radio City Music Hall and Times Square. The wait staff is extremely friendly and very helpful, the prices seemed a little high but when our meals came out it was well worth the price, huge steaks and what seemed like an entire small chicken on our plates with plentiful side dishes. Overall a great experience, great selection of food and drink, will definitely be returning here.

I really liked this place. Went here with a party of 6 after seeing the tree at Rockefeller Center. They sat us within a few minutes. The waiters were friendly and attentive. Nice decor, also. The bison nachos were great! So was the veggie burger. Everyone really enjoyed their meal. Especially my brother who got the bison steak.

A taste of the cowboy life in the heart of the big apple.To start off with I had the bison chilli. An invigorating awakening of my taste buds ensued. The jalapeño slices on the top of the chilli was a nice touch.I proceeded to the bison steak. This took ages till it finally came. However, it was well worth the wait. Succulent and tender meat that melts in one's mouth. Yet 8oz was a rather meager portion for a steak and did not fill me up. For the price I paid I was expecting more.The roasted asparagus was a let down. Really soggy and oily, they seemed fried rather than roasted.On the whole, this was a mediocre culinary experience with room for improvement.

Came here with 2 family members that highly recommended it. I went in not knowing what to expect and given how underwhelmed I was, I think that's a good thing. As an appetizer, they insisted on ordering the Bison Nachos. They would've been ok if the kitchen hadn't been so skimpy with the toppings! Literally after the 5 chips right on top, all the chips underneath were just bare and unappetizing. I was hoping my actual entree would be better (I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger Bison Burger with half fries and half onion rings) so I just opted to wait for that. The burger itself was good but nothing mind-blowing for me. As for the french fries (kinda soggy - I've definitely had better; I didn't finish them) and the onion rings everyone raves about (they were crunchy but a bit too on the greasy side for me - I was only given 3 and could only manage to stomach 2 of them, which is crazy because I generally love onion rings), I was disappointed. After eating all I could, I actually felt queasy (I I think the greasiness of the fries and onion rings had more of an affect than I'd anticipated, and that's saying a lot because I can down a burger and fries with the best of them). In terms of the restaurant itself, the ambiance was nice and seemingly more on the upscale side (there were quite a few suits in there, which I'm sure is largely attributed to the location) but after sitting down at the table, I got the impression that Ted's is a bit confused as to what exactly it wants to be: upscale or "down-home" style? The huge salt container (like the ones you buy at the supermarket to cook with that was sitting on the table; there were no salt and pepper shakers on any of the tables) especially gave me this impression. That was definitely off-putting (especially since whenever you attempt to use it, salt just pours out in a steady stream). Overall, Ted's didn't offer me anything I'd come back for. Sadly, the most interesting part of this dining experience for me was the dry natural soap supplied in the bathroom.

Big bummer. Was hoping to like it, but unfortunately the place was two-thirds empty for good reasons. The salad was fine and was the side Brussels sprouts, but the main entree of their $38 bone-in bison ribeye was thinly cut and very fatty...NOT what I have had before in Montana :(For good steaks, perhaps good to try elsewhere.

Ted's used to be a 4 for me. Their bacon bison burger is legit. I especially love the pickles that they serve when you sit down. Unfortunately, the last bacon bison burger I had at Ted's will be my last - for life. I was violently sick for 5 days. I plan to send Ted Turner a note seeking compensation for the pain and suffering I endured.
Nice place for casual sit down lunch. Will try bison steak next time.

Is it wrong that I liked the appetizers more than the main entree? Let's face it, this place isn't Lugers nor does it pretend to be, but it's a fairly good option for drinks after hours in the midtown area. Our group of seven ordered the crab cakes, shrimp, and onion rings and everything was pretty tasty, with the exception of my burger. Lesson learned: Stop by for fairly good HH specials and apps, not so much for the main entree.
The bison burger is amazing!  Very flavorful and it didn't need any sauces to enhance the taste.

If you can get the back room, I'd highly suggest that. It can fit about 8-10 people and it makes for a somewhat intimate lunch. The food here isn't great. It reminds me of silly chain restaurants like Fridays, especially the starters. For my entree, I had the bison meatloaf and it was pretty bland. Definitely not worth the $18.
My friend liked his steak but mine was awful , so awful I just stopped eating in the middle. I don't recommend about this place at all.

My bf got the Teds Burger w/Sweet Potato fries & said it's one if the best burgers he's ever had. I had the Cranberry Roasted Chicken w/green beans and mash potatoes and it was delicious! Big portions for our meals.

Ted' Montana Grill never let you down, wherever you are and whichever Ted's you enter the quality, the portion, the staff are all outstanding.The best price quality- quantity -relationship you can ever imagine.The bison steaks are a must stop for European visitors, they just simply say : "wow, you can really find good food in America" ;) The atmosphere is simply perfect, the real America at its best :) Elegant, simple, sophisticated and welcoming and cozy all in one :)I love taking there all my friends that come from overseas they really feel like they have really been in the US, and finally tried a real burger or a great Steak.As Miguel De Unamuno said: "... you love with your stomach..."Basically Ted is perfect :)

This place was a great find! I usually get frustrated when I need to find food in midtown, but I think I've found a place I want to go again and again. They've got a great menu with a variety of burgers. I had a bite of the bison filet and my own basalmic bleu salad (HIGHLY recommend), and it was exactly what I wanted. They have *real* lemonade here too, none of that pulp-less concentrate. Really enjoyed the bison nachos too -- thanks fellow Yelpers for recommending it!
Great price. Service was good. Steak was juicy and cooked as ordered. Garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus were great.

Boss man just offered to treat the team to Ted's for lunch today!!!! WOOHOO!!!!!!!!!!!  Been wanting to try this place for a while.  And methinks I'll do a live review this time!Pickles: AWESOME!!!  Not sure if they make them on premises...or they get them local...but these taste handmade, non-jarred!  Slight bite of garlic, perfect crisp, some brine...amazeballs!!!!Fries: fresh-cut, skin-on...not steak cut, but nicely thick, stayed decent in the container brought back by one of the other assistants, and not overly salted.  ME LIKES!!!Burger: I got the Avalon, opting for the Bison option: Arugula, some sort of aioli, caramelized onions, gruyere, hint of blue, order medium-rare.   Gimme one minute, y'all.... *OM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM GULP SMACK OM NOM NOM MIIINNNEEEEE!!!!*Now THAT was one damned fine burger!!!!!!  It stayed in the medium rare range, even though it stayed in the delivery container for a good 20+ minutes...and was still nicely warm.  The burger was very moist and juicy, though the bun was not soggy.  The toppings were perfectly paired in texture, flavor, and quantity....just.....lovely.I'mma have to sleep on it......but this might be the best bison burger I've ever had.I can't speak for the atmosphere, or the prices....but I will be ordering from them again, and opting to try them for after work drinks and such!

I came here with my office for a lunch and it was a great experience. I ordered the grilled salmon and thoroughly enjoyed my meal. It didn't blow me away. The service was great and the prices were fair.
Great happy hour with a friendly staff.  The bison nachos were delicious!

This place is 100% average. Food is average. Service is poor. Even during lunch time when we're in on business lunch they're slow. Every time I've asked for a drink I have to remind the waiter multiple times. Save yourself the annoyance and go somewhere - anywhere else.
Good Happy Hour specials and delicious nachos.  Good spot for weeknight happy hour.

I come here for a bison burger here a couple of times a year when I'm craving it and it always gets the job done. Can't comment on anything else on the menu since I haven't had it but I'm sure it's like any other Ted's location if you've been to any of the others.

I went here on a Tuesday night with my company management and coworkers. The ambiance is great. It's nice and quiet and the staff is very attentive.I didn't feel rushed and my team and I spent over 3 hours there, just eating, drinking and having a good time. I ordered the Bison New York Strip, medium rare with portobello mushrooms. The food was excellent. I also had a Brooklyn Lager (the green one), not so great but that was my fault (and I prefer the winter version).Overall, I give this place 5 stars - I'm hearing impaired, so quietness in the restaurant is important to me as well as staff patience when I ask them to repeat certain things.Thank you Ted Montana. I had a wonderful and memorable time.

No, this is not some super-special NYC gem, but it's got consistently delicious comfort food in a lovely, old-school Manhattan atmosphere. I usually get the cedar plank salmon or the crab cakes, and the salmon is always perfectly cooked with a great wood-smoked taste. It's also one of the few places in this area that isn't crazy expensive, and it doesn't feel like a tourist trap.

MEH.If you work at UBS and need to have a nice business lunch fast it's OK. Nice decor, classy, OK service....actually been here like four times, waiters never smile and always take long, they take your food order then bring you your food, no "how are you doings" in between. Prob. because they are so packed all the time during lunch. Make no mistake though, they are packed because of their prime location next to 1000 law firms and UBS, not because of their mediocre food. It's a good lunch. Better than europa cafe for sure. And it's not particuarly pricey.Would never come here for dinner.

I went to Ted's a few days ago for lunch, and I had a very enjoyable experience! Based on the location, I thought it would be either very touristy or full of suits engaged in business lunches. Luckily, it was neither. The food was quality, the clientele was mixed with locals, tourists, and business folk, and the staff was super friendly and attentive. On this visit, I had their New Mexico burger with beef (they also offer bison for their burgers). This delicious and tender burger was topped with pepper Jack cheese, roasted Anaheim peppers, spicy tomato jam, and yummy guacamole! Definitely worth getting again!! Fries were served on the side with the burger, and these were super tasty as well. I didn't taste any of their cocktails, but I did order diet coke, which was the fountain variety... and served with the small crunchy ice pieces that you find in Sonic sodas. What a treat! Also, the sodas were all-you-can-drink as they should be at every restaurant-- don't you just hate it when a restaurant is so high and mighty that they don't offer free refills on soda?As for atmosphere, the place has a very masculine feel inside (lots of wood) but still very fresh and up-to-date looking and neither stuffy nor pretentious. The staff is also very friendly and attentive. I'll most certainly give this place another go sometime soon!

I only rate it average considering the level and competition of other restaurants - but I have to say that if you are looking for a quick, satisfying and reasonably priced meal, this is a very good place in manhattanMy standbys are the salmon, the steak salad and the burgers - they arable excellent and come out very quickYou will not be disappointed by the food or the prices

Went there for dinner around the holidays....really long wait not sure if its because it was a holiday but still an hour and a half wait...is never good when your waiting for an hour and half when it comes to going to a restaurant and your dead hunger.... After waiting for an hour and a half final got seats ...which I was really happy about lol...after being seated the waiter asked us what would you like this and that... but he wasn't a good server..not good at all...really sloppy ...I pretty rude....The food finally came out half an hour later and it was actually really yummy the steak was so good so was the fish.. But even though the food is good the wait and the services sucked which makes me think twice about going back and eating there again...

This was my second visit to Ted's and on both occasions it was a group lunch with my work colleagues. The first time was a group pg 4 and this time was a group of 7. We had a 12pm reservations and it took a while to get seated as it seemed a lot of people came in at the same time. The hostess area is not located in the best place so it gets a bit cramped and awkward waiting to be seated and you constantly have to try to get out of other people's ways.The 7 of us were initially seated at a 5 person table round table and we were quite cramped. Per our request however, they moved us to a booth, which was much more comfortable.We all had burgers and there were no complaints made. I had the bison green and hot and I thought it was ok. My burger tasted like bland meat, the guac added nothing to save it and the jalapenos were barely grilled. I also had the 50/50 and the fries were way better than the onion rings. Most people at our table had sweet potato fries and they seemed to like them.Overall, the service was good, but I find that for the price, the burger could be much better.

One of the worst meals I've ever had in NYC.  I had been to Ted's Montana Grill a few years ago while my parents were staying in a Midtown hotel.  It was unexceptional but perfectly fine.  We went back because we were in a pinch looking for dinner before a show at Radio City Music Hall.  What a mistake.There were four of us dining that night, and none of us were happy with our food.  I ordered the crab cakes.  It was a travesty.  The two people who ordered hamburgers found them dry, like eating sawdust.  The diner who had a steak probably had the best experience, but she said it was tasteless and boring.  There are many wonderful restaurants in New York.  They may be harder to find in the Midtown area, but they do exist.  Do yourself a favor and stay away from this place!
Great food , look for Charles he's a nice & funny guy .. He will help you with your order , environment is amazing , worth the money
Prices didn't match their online menu (some were a bit higher). Service was fine, although the food suffered a bit because we went on Thanksgiving and they were quite busy.
Enjoyable meal.  I had the bison blue cheese burger, first time trying bison, and it was delicious!  Also, great margaritas!

Nice ambiance, prompt service.  Got the veggie burger which was okay as it was  mushy and not too much texture.  Fries were slightly overdone.  Love the whole recyclables story and action.  Was a bit weird to drink out of a paper straw, but cool at the same time.

Went here with the family for dinner after the Radio City Christmas Spectacular on a Saturday night. This place is an absolute disaster !  Yelp should have 1/2 star ratings. Being in the restaurant business myself, the food was absolutely appalling. I usually don't complain, but I felt this time I had too.  First off, it took forever to get a simple round of beverages. Secondly, when the "mini" plates of salad we ordered finally arrived, the lettuce was brown and wilted. A bowl of soup we ordered arrived with the meal lukewarm and salty as sin. You could wake the dead with it ! Furthermore, food was overcooked, loaded in salt, ice cold French fries, dried up baked potatoes. Some of the saddest looking plates I have ever seen. Now I understand they are in the backyard of Rockefeller center, but heck, put some pride in the dishes you serve. My roasted chicken dish, as tasty as it was, was ice cold, and missing a vegetable it was supposed to come with. I mean really, for $166.00, I expected better food.  The waitress as sweet as she was, seemed overwhelmed with tables and was probably exhausted since it was 9:30 when we were seated. Save your money, go somewhere else where food is served with pride !

Just had the most awful turkey dinner here for Thanksgiving. Mashed potatoes very dry, green beans way undercooked --really just blanched, sloppy unappealing plate. So very mediocre. Missing sides. And so expensive! Online menu said $ 25.00, but it was$ 45.00 a piece at this location. Most I have every pain for a bad meal. If you want a traditional turkey dinner in NYC look elsewhere!

First, I always appreciate a gluten-free menu, so thanks for that, Ted. Next step is to throw a bag of GF buns in the pantry. Their GF menu offers no substitutes. It just lists their GF dishes or says, "order without the bun." Baby steps.We've been here three times and each time the food is good and the service is horrid. Today, Black Friday, we went before Radio City. They were out of their delicious pickles and said, "It's a disaster back there after Thanksgiving yesterday. They're trying to find more." Not comforting. Then the hostess packed giant parties into the dining room and simultaneously created an obstacle course for all the servers. After a few minutes of having the back of my chair humped by every server in the place as they tried to navigate between the patrons, I moved to the other side of the table. As usual, food was good. Location is ideal. Service is friendly but disorganized and slow.Oh, and Ted, ladies don't like to wash their hands with Boraxo. It's not cute. It's taking the ranch theme a bit far.

This place is a disaster. Never again! We had the wrong order and the woman that helped us was LESS than helpful. The tall blonde manager or "proprietor"  (she had a rainbow tattoo on her wrist) was very rude and not professional. As someone in the hospitality for over 30 years, I would never eat there nor would I hire incompetent people. Stay away.

I've had the burgers here a few times.  They are just not good.  There is something "rank" tasting about them.  Ive tried both the Bison and the Beef (hence me being back a second time.  I heard the Bison was "better".  I think not.  At least not here any way.  I recall when they first opened, the food was much better.
Pretty solid. Bacon bison cheese burger was juicy and delicious.

Overall, its a solid restaurant choice in a neighborhood filled with an uneven range of  option - either SUPER expensive (looking at your Le Bernadin or Capital Grille) or very affordable (think Chipotle, Olive Garden, Steak N' Shake, or TGI Friday's).  The ribeye was lean cooked medium, and I was told to definitely try the Bison next time.  The portion size was good, and the drinks were free flowing - all for a good price. We've never had an issue getting a table, and I can imagine that a Happy Hour is probably a good time at this neighborhood gem.  Not pretentious in their service, and these happy customers will be back again.

I was so happy that the portion was so perfect.  I hate it when a steak house over serves their food and you are practically forced to get a to-go bag.  I don't wanna take my stinky food to the theatre or my car even.  So the size of everything, steak, veggies were great.  And the bison was perfectly seasoned.  More side veggie options would have been great for this no-carb eater.

Great food and great service. My husband and I stopped here for a steak dinner before going out to a Broadway show. The service was excellent. We had drinks in the bar before the dining room opened. The bar staff and the dining staff were friendly and speedy. The food was wonderful as well.
What can I say!  Ted's at its best!  Lealand you rocked as our waiter!  So funny, knowledgeable of gluten free and had an awesome personality...Thanks for the extra fries...: )  Francine

First time here. I got the bison filet and it was incredible; after a couple over-done (beef) steaks from well-known NYC steakhouses, this one was perfect. When I've had bison, it's tended to be a bit dry, but this was moist and tender and delicious. The garlic mashed potatoes and merlot were good too. I'd give the food 5 stars; the service lagged for our party of 12, but it wasn't a big deal, as we were socializing.For as healthy and tasty as that steak was, I'll definitely be back.
Came here for dinner, had a bison burger,, was delish, nice attentive staff and quiet. Would come again!.

It's a chain restaurant, so if you don't like that, then it might not be for you.  Also, it has paper straws which are disgusting.  But the food!!! It hits the spot every time, and the servers are very nice.  As a result of pre-planned business lunches, I wound up visiting this place three times in a short period of time with different people, and by the third visit the waiter remembered me and my favorite dish.

Meh indeed. Came here for a business lunch today and, while the service was better than I've experienced in the past, the food still didn't thrill me.  I ordered the cedar plank salmon which was tasty, but was a little undercooked in the center and incredibly salty!! Halfway through I couldn't put myself through eating anymore. I didn't bother saying anything to the waiter since we were in a rush.Their garlic mashed potatoes and string beans are both very tasty and I enjoyed the house salad with blue cheese dressing.I'm happy they have an environmentally friendly option for straws and while they initially freaked me out (they are cardboard), I think they are growing on me.Also make sure you have a lint remover at your desk as they have white napkins that left white fuzz all over our suits.

I always enjoy stopping in at Ted's when I'm in NYC. This is my first time for lunch. Usually I finish the day and have dinner.  The food is always good, is reasonably priced and the service has always been top notch, efficient, and very friendly. My favorite item, which I have ordered again today as a lunch, is the Cedar Plank Salmon; a healthy choice even. And wasabi mashed potatoes....gotta love it!

I went here last night with three other women before going to an 8 o'clock show at Radio City. We had 6:30 reservations but the weather kinda sucked n we were done walking around so we went in at about 5:20 n figured we'd sit at the bar for a while. The bar was very crowded so the hostess sat us in a booth which worked out well. Initially our waiter came over, I don't remember if he told us his name. He took our drink order n walked away, one of the women changed her mind about her drink n he kind of rolled his eyes n told us he'd have to run n tell the bartender to cancel it out. Everyone got their drinks n we ordered our food. For apps we had grilled shrimp which were awesome n the bison nachos which were also good. Our main course came out while our appetizers were still on the table which wasn't really a big deal except that he didn't clean all the dirty plates from the table before putting down our food. I had the Avalon bison burger which was delicious n juicy, my mother had a bison burger as well with bacon n a fried egg on it, she loved it. The other two women had a filet n a fried chicken sandwich. No complaints, everyone thought the food was great. Somewhere in between bites of my burger the dinner rush came in n our waiter disappeared. We weren't in a rush by any means but we did want more drinks n when we finally found him n ordered he smiled politely n walked away. We got a coffee, tea, my sangria and a frangelico. The coffee and tea came out but there was no sugar. My sangria came out n we had to ask 3 times for the frangelico at which point he told us "well, some people havent gotten their dinner yet." Guess who's problem that isn't? Mine! The table next to us also had a problem with the same waiter n the manager had to come fix things. Like I said, the food was great, maybe this guy was new or having a bad day, regardless a busy restaurant a block away from Radio City probably isn't the place for this guy. So overall, the food was great but I wouldn't go here if you're in a rush.
Good Place.  Had the Bison Ribeye.  Decent price for NYC.  Food was very good.  Make a reservation for 6 via yelp/open table, they were ready with a table when we arrived.

I have mixed emotions about this place. Granted, their burgers are delicious (I always opt for the bison), but the delmonico steak is decent at best. The cooking was fine, but it lacked flavor to me. The crab cakes are good but small. However, I highly recommend the salad, very fresh and yummy.

I have only been here once for lunch and had a pleasant experience. Classy restaurant with attentive service. The prices were not too bad either. I had chicken with fries and vegetables on the side. The chicken was a bit dry and no wow factor but still pretty tasty decent food. It's a grill restaurant, so obviously a lot of options for meat lovers. I'd like to come back and try more dishes.

Tasty tasty. I got the best Fish dish and it was pretty tasty. And for all you glutton free folk, they do have a glutton free menu (if you ask for it). Good piece of info if you need it.I liked the feel of the place and the menu does give you plenty of options if you like beef or bison. There are salads, with a good portion of meat in them. Just be prepared for that. I mean, this is that type of place. Being someone who doesn't like meat, but eats fish and veggies like no other and not having made the reservations, I can say I had options. I'll most likely come back to try out some other options. The meat eaters in my group did love whatever they got. Ted's is probably a place you want to go to eat, not a take out type place. The amount of tables here and prior reviews makes me think that during peak hours you should not order take out. Hopefully next time we get a booth. Those booths are pretty sweet looking.Interesting things you'll find at Ted's: Paper based straws at every table (threw me a little off, but I'm impressed with their choice), powdered soap in the bathroom (also threw me off), and a Buffalo head mounted high on the wall.

So I know there is a first time for everything, but I kind of feel like I should have been prepped on this place before ordering.Bison.... something completely new to me, so I did not want to get too adventurous. I thought I would stick with a Salad but have the Bison meat instead of the regular burger meat. Maybe Bison is an acquired task, but I can tell you I did not like it. I tried to make it work in my salad with the thousand island dressing, but it was not working.The Bison Nacho chips on the other hand was pretty good. That was a subtle intro Bison that worked out fine, but the salad was just a no no.

Ok, let me say I have never eaten dinner here, so my comments are based on lunch and happy hour visits.  Ted's has by far and away the best bison burger in NYC.  The bison across the street at Heartland Brewer is awful and I would only call their's as a meat-related products, whereas Ted's is perfectly cooked.I work across the street, so this is a goto spot for lunch. Recently, I have noticed that their burgers seem to be served with very skimpy portions of onions and tomatoes, so I hope that was not a bad sign.Happy hour these guys have $3 Yueling, which is nice.

I love me some bison but average service and food didn't have me completely raving about this place!No wait for 2 people at 6:00 ish on a sat. Cool but had me a bit nervous ( is this place that bad?).Waitress asked if we were ready to order 2 times in the first 5 minutes (menus open) and then was lost when we were ready.Place is cool, casual although it looks upscale from outside.My bison chili tasted like regular beef, the only difference was in the slightly softer texture and those Jalapenos kicked my ass!!!The Avalon bison burger was cooked well. I love bison blue chz crumbles and bacon.  The fries were average no better then an Applebees. The bun... Humm.. Not a problem but it was uncooked. I like my buns a bit toasty :) it was very fresh and soft though.Cost, very reasonable especially for the location.I would go back, it was affordable and different then most other chain restaurants i have been to.
Food bug alert!!! I ate here last night and ordered a bacon cheeseburger with onions. I woke up this morning with the worst onion taste in my gut and puked all morning....I will NEVER eat here again.

This is a fun place to go. I have been around 5 times and have enjoyed each occasion. The burgers are good and I like buffalo. The ambiance is fun and generally it is a feel good place to go. Think buffalo heads on the wall and as close as you are going to get to the wild west in Manhattan. I am not sure it is the best place to take a vegetarian or if you are on a diet, but if you are looking for hearty buffalo or beef burgers (and other dishes) then you should really come on down. Having drinks and food here with friends makes it a great experience and it has earned its 5 stars in my eyes.

I was at a CO location with my bf once and we both loved it, so I brought him to the NYC location as a surprise on his birthday, right after boating in Central Park.  The location itself is very clean, the decor is comfortable (we got a booth), and it looked similar to the CO location without being exactly the same, which I like.  Our wait was very nice, patient, and attentive throughout the meal.  It was like 4pm on a Sunday in the middle of the summer, so it was pretty empty.My bf ordered one of the burgers and he really liked it (i tried some too).  I got the steak salad, which had fried onions on top (yay! negating the whole getting-a-salad-thing!), a balsamic reduction,  and big pieces of steak in it.  I actually thought the steak pieces were TOO big - more like they cut up some steak and threw it on top, and you couldn't really combine forkfuls of other salad components with the steak.  Also, the edges of some pieces were kind of fatty - some people like this, I don't.  Overall, though, I really liked the salad!  We also had a coupon for a free cookie (sign up online and get it on your birthday!) which was also tasty. Not that we needed it after stuffing ourselves, but still.Portions are definitely good, but the prices aren't cheap, either.  I guess for NYC it's pretty decent (maybe $15 for a burger).  However, this was the nostalgic, tasty end to a really memorable day :)  Thanks, Ted!
Great food. Complete crap for service. If Erin waits on you, prepare to be waiting.

Really delicious food and a beautiful location.  If you come during lunch you might find yourself in a very crowded space.  Most of the Time and Life building empties into the restaurant for lunch Monday's through Fridays.  But most of the time it is a calm, rustic environment with delicious Bison steaks and burgers.  The rest of the items on the menu are also delicious but can be found most elsewhere.  Come here to get a delicious healthier choice for your red meats.

Where else in the city can you have a bison burger cooked for you in a restaurant owned by Ted Turner?  If this has been your dream, well look no further.A traditional meat and potatoes type place, Ted's offers a wide variety of burgers, chicken and steak dishes.  Decent bar selections as well.The portions are pretty good, never a wait (even at lunch time... well most of the time) and the food is good.
meh... if TT wasn't on the marquee it would be more deserted than it already is.

The Del Monico Ribeye is amazing, the Cranberry Glazed Chicken is also good.Service is still slow, but servers are still great.This place is a local staple for us, we go at least once a week and I would say at least 1 out of 10 times, the food isn't up to par.
I went in this restaurant in 2009, when I was visiting NY, and I loved the food! The portions are very big and the bison was very tasty!The idea of using recycle material is a plus!

I Soooooo want to love this place. I'm a big Bison fan. Maybe comes from my days in Denver rooting for CU. It's healthy and tastes as good or better than beef. Ted's specializes in Bison (some mistakenly call it Buffalo). They offer steaks, burgers meatloaf and chili. I've been here twice now and they're just not consistent enough to recommend. The bison ribeye I just finished was perfect. Juicy, tender and cooked to perfection (medium rare, careful - don't go past medium on Bison or it'll dry out.) But my daughters tenderloin was overcook to medium well. Yet her potato was raw? And my sweet potato (yam) was about the size of two golf balls. The asparagus still had the chewy bases on them. I had to cut them off myself. The server did not come back after dropping the dishes off to inquire how things were until we were done eating. Then he asked how things were. Too late now pal. Where were you 15 minutes ago when we cut into everything?To be fair, the last time I was here, everything was fine, but at these prices you just can't depend on the quality you will get here. When it's good, it's great, but  I'd rather go around the corner to Del Frisco's, pay a bit more and know I'm going to have my world rocked. Footnote, as I finished this review on my iPhone, the waiter presented me with the check and removed the overcooked entree. I boosted from two to three stars.
