Loved the atmosphere inside.  I went here first with a party and loved my experience.  The service was very good.  The bison burger was one of the best I ever had.  But I came back for a second time and found a hair in my burger! EW!! The place was really crowded then, and I thought it could have been a careless mistake of a chef.  Grossed me out! Ruined that experience.I do like that the restaurant is enviro-friendly, with paper straw and powder soap!!

I went to this place for a client lunch.  The staff was friendly and we were seated rather quickly.  After we ordered the food took FOREVER TO COME!! Once the food arrived the burger I ordered,beef, was gross.  I am sorry, but it tasted soft and weird.  I picked at the fries which were OK, but only played with the burger.  Luckily, the client loved it.  Honestly speaking, I will not return unless a client requests this place again.

Been here twice. Ted Montana's is an average restaurant in the area and certainly is no comparison to Capital Grille next door for food quality. If you want value for your $, Ted's is the spot with generous portions and plenty to choose from.Bison meat is very gamey. I had it in the sliders we ordered and wasn't a fan of it. The Bison Nachos we had were kinda luke warm. The chips didn't seem to be freshly fried or anything. Relatively skimpy on the bison chili on our order and had non existent pepper jack cheese on it. When I dug into the middle, the chips were lukewarm and a bit soggy. Makes me wonder how long it was sitting in the kitchen.Ordered the Kitchen Sink burger and yes they do throw everything at it! A ~1400 calorie burger approximately and I was only able to get through half of it before putting up the white flag. When you try the beef itself, it's more on the salty side. Overall the burger was tasty but not the best. I personally enjoy the burgers at RARE much better.

I went here two weeks ago with my boyfriend. The interior is very clean and the booths we sat at were very comfortable. The first thing i love about Ted's Montana Grill is that they are super ecofriendly: from their borax soap in the bathroom to their paper straws. The next thing that I love in a restaurant is quality service. Our waiter was incredibly patient and nice. I ordered the America's Cup bison burger. The patty and the onions were so tender and juicy. It came with a side, you can choose from a long list; I chose the baked potato, baked to perfection. Pricing was about $17 pretty much average for a burger in the city.

BISON BURGER.Never had bison until now... but it was pretty darn good.  Little bit gamey, but not too intense.I was invited here for a free business lunch and ordered the $17 Bison burger - RED ROCK STYLE (Pepper Jack Cheese, Fresh Jalepenos, Cilantro, Fried Onion Straws, and Signature Z-Sauce).  Their Z-Sauce was little bit sweet... complimented the burger very well.TIP:  Order the bison patty MEDIUM RARE.  The patty came out more like MEDIUM.... so for those folks that like their meat medium, your patty is going to be BONE DRY if you ORDER MEDIUM.I ordered the burger with a side of half and half.  Half FRIES and half ONION RINGS.  I'm not a big fan of onion rings in general... but the batter on them was nice and crunchy.  Worth getting if you're going to get the burger.TIP:  Go early.  The place gets packed very quickly with suits during lunch.CONCLUSION:Get the BISON burger if you're on a free lunch.  I'm not sure if I would really pay $17 out of pocket for it... but cool to try the bison burger just once.

Had a Bison, bacon and cheddar burger that actually lacked favor.We didn't realize it was a Ted Turner/corporate chain restaurant at first, but decide to try it anyway.  It's a mid-level chain... won't be going back.

Super friendly staff. I even asked the waiter about their HH and though it was 7, he said it ends at 7:15. To be on the safe side, he ordered our second round and put it into the system so we wouldn't miss out.Stayin' classy.I had their burger and was pretty impressed. I'm not going to bore you with the cliche "Juicy, hearty, succulent patty" that you're used to reading everywhere so here it is: if you trust my reviews, trust me, this burger is for real.

Came here for lunch with a party of three. Arrived at 11:45am. Thank God because if it had been 15 minutes later we would've been in the insane crowd that appeared. SO always make sure to get there just before 12 or after 1pm. Otherwise you will be waiting. Friendly waiter, nice atmosphere, and almost all men. If you are a single lady, go here!! I had George's Cadillac Burger and it was wonderful! I highly recommend it. A great addition were my onion rings (alternative to fries). Decent prices for the area too!
Great bite, good price.I had the beef swiss mushroom burger. If you are in the area and wanted a good burger, then this is your place.Will I go there again: Yes.

Such a great find! Went for dinner during the early evening hours while visiting the city, and the place still had plenty of seating available. Service was both friendly and fast. Very eco-friendly, right down to the straws made out of recycled materials. (Nice touch, Ted Turner!)The food was amazing. The portions were huge. I had the 'Flying-D' Chili Bison Burger, and it blew my mind. The lights were kept dim, making for a very cozy atmosphere. Very clean place, including the restrooms. I'd return the next time I'm in town.

So good and perfect if you have kids with you. We went on a Monday and that is potato soup night it was so good. I had the burger with Monterey jack cheese guacamole and fresh jalepenos. It was sooooo good. My husband had the classic burger but he got the bison. He loved it!  We both wish there is a location closer to our house.  We also got the mountain breeze martini OMG loved it! My kids had mini burgers and the kids grilled cheese both were eaten by smiling faces. All in all this place is so worth it. Next time I'm in the city I am going back!
Poor service, the steak was ok, definitely not the typical NY steak. It's relatively cheap though.

I've eaten here half a dozen times and I've never had my burger cooked right. Every time I order it medium rare, and every time they hand me a well done slab of half-dry bison meat.Seriously. It's a burger. If I'm dropping $20 for a burger the least you can do is cook it correctly.I hate to give 1 star, because there are plenty of things to like. You can tell the food quality is there, and so is the flavor. The fries are tasty but very inconsistent and rarely crispy. My problem is the price. If you're going to charge like you're a upscale restaurant, you should have the standards of one.

Decent burgers, great atmosphere and super friendly staff. If your in the area and looking for a quick bite. I would recommend coming over here. Especially if you don't want to go to McDonalds or Bruger king. Try the Bison its good!!!Bison nachos: B+Onion rings: B Green and Hot B (Not that hot)Red Rock have it with Bison

its close to work so ive been a few times for lunch. never had a bad experience and i enjoy the burgers. one little perk is the sliced pickles that are on the tables once you sit down, theyre good. i usually go bison burger, very tasty. sometimes there is a long wait.
It's a burger and steak joint. Nice and decent, but large and noisy as well. Burgers a bit on the small size... ;-)
Went for a quick network lunch and was happy with expereince.  Food was prompt and fresh.  I had the SOL Bison Burger, yummy.  Fries were limp.  Server was not up to speed.

This was my second time at the restuarant.  I try to not post negative reviews unless something happens twice just in case it was a fluke.  Everyone has a bad day sometime, ya know.  But this was my second encounter with their horrible wait staff.I needed a napkin while I was eating my burger because ketchup leaked was all over my hands.  As the waitress walked by I asked her for a napkin and she said sure.. Then she never returned. I watched her walking around in circles doing laps around the restaurant but never checking on her tables.  I flagged her down again and said I really need that napkin and I showed her the ketchup on my hands.  she again NEVER RETURNED.  I got up, went to another table and picked up my own napkin.  When she finally came back she absent mindedly handed me a napkin which landed on the other side of the table.  I politely told her that I had to take one off another table because I couldn't wait that long.. She just shrugged; no apologies for her awful service.Had to ask her for change twice because she purposely brought big bills to bump up her tip.  AWFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I will never ever ever go there again.  The Food isn't even that good.  I only went there because they are close to Radio city music hall... Heartland Brewery is across the street.  I will go there instead!

Pretty terrible.Incompetent but apologetic service.Small, fishy, crabcakeCorked glass of wine, sent back, 15 minutes for a new one to arriveChili cheese fries arrived with stone cold fries and unmelted cheese, we sent it back and had to tell them to put it under the broilerOrdered coleslaw (also terrible, btw) with burger (2 medium and one medium rare all arrived well done) but got more cold fries insteadProbably the worst meal I have had out anywhere in a great long while. All it was really missing was a kick in the ass on the way out the door.Won't be going back ever. Avoid at all costs

They have bison burgers!!! So delicious...so juicy....yum. Add a glass of lemonade to make me happy with my cardboard straw.  Pretty good hand cut fries as well but oversalted/ peppered onion rings you should pass on. A dish of sliced cucumbers comes instead of a bread basket. Extras: Calories noted on menu. Check out the bathroom for the two way flusher and powder hand soap.
If you have the need to walk on the Western side, come here and have some bison. Pretty much anything on the menu can have bison substituted into it instead of beef.
The margarita and biscuits gave Ted his 3rd star. The bison meatloaf is okay, but my ground turkey loaf tastes better.

Exceedingly average. I love Bison but this doesn't seem to be a great place for it, giant mounted buffalo head on the wall notwithstanding. Service was spotty, decor and ambiance were nice enough, but food was nothing to write (or even text) home about.

I read some reviews on Ted's after having gone with a few co-workers for lunch. Most reviewers are claiming that the service is horrible, which it was. Sad to say that when you ask for any garnish, refills, etc. it just will not arrive. I had a bison burger with swiss and mushrooms that was average. We did order this thickly sliced potato chip appet. with fun dips that I crave from time to time. Everything else about this place was mediocre.

Bison burgers are delicious with a wide menu of different styles along with bison steaks. The decor is nice, lots of wood with a very nature like feeling. It's an open kitchen so you see them cooking. Fries come from a potato that slice right there so it's never been frozen and the onion rings are huge and delicious. The cookies are baked fresh and are theeee best cookies I've ever had. Lunch can be a little hectic, dinner is mellow with better service. I like eating at Ted's every now and then and definitely think you get your money's worth.

In terms of the value - especially given the neighborhood - and the relatively nice environment, I'd give Ted's 4 stars, but they fail to get pretty basic stuff right. Went here last night and sat at the bar for an early dinner. I ordered one of their specialty cocktails - the Ultimate Dirty Martini - mostly because it had olives stuffed with blue cheese. Accordingly, the drink served had plain olives. I ordered the Spikebox bison burger which comes with monterey jack cheese, jalapenos and bacon. Sadly, there were only three jalapenos slices and the fries were barely above room temperature. However, the food overall was pretty tasty. The bartenders were, on the whole, inept. I asked for mustard, it never appeared. I asked again. My cocktail was finished, I was extremely thirsty (the didn't offer water at the outset) and had to flag them down to get a beer. I would understand if they were busy, but it was 5:30 and there were just a few people at the bar. It's a place with good intentions (being green for one), but it just falls short on the execution. That said, I will return when I'm stuck in this area of the city, as it's a good place to relax with decent grub, and I'm sure they can do better next time.

I go when I'm touring in Atlanta all the time! But now I had a certificate from restaurants.com and went with my girlfriend in NYC for the first time. The food is terrific!! I can't complain! Good spot!
Ok I may have been starving but really this was the best bison meatloaf I have ever had. The new pickles....we were fighting for it right to the last bite....

I had never been here before and it was quite interesting. I ordered the buffalo short ribs and while I was reminded that I don't actually like buffalo they were expertly prepared. Everything was well prepared and the restaurant is very "green" paper straws and all that but hey, I like to do my part for the environment so it was fine. the service was good and it wasn't overly expensive. If I could learn to like buffalo I would definitely go back

I went here based on my friend's suggestion of bison burgers. We got our own private room for a party of 8. The lighting was ambient and I liked how the soap was powdered and exfoliated your hands. Ted makes an effort to be eco-friendly, for example the straws are 99% plastic free. I ordered the Vermejo Bison burger which came with one side (substitutes allowed) of steamed broccoli and no butter. The burger was very delicious but my friend said the burgers here were actually a bit small than the ones he's had in other states. I was full after the meal and didn't have room for their highly acclaimed malts. The service was good in the beginning but then we didn't see the server after our food was served. The rest of the party enjoyed their bison burgers so that's why I gave it four stars.

I've been here several times and love their food! What keeps me going back is the amazing bison burger with swiss cheese and sour cream on a wheat roll. (just drooled a little) It is my favorite.The chili is usually good, although last time it was just OK. Service is friendly and fast, prices are decent.I have no complaints ...

I really like this place as a midtown lunch option.  It's usually pretty busy but there's not a wait.  There's now a $10 lunch menu, but a burger will run you about $15 (that'd be on the high side for a bison burger).  They give you huge onion rings or fries or both with your order which just makes it even better since they let you substitute as you wish.The bison burgers themselves are really good as they're super juicy compared to their beef burgers.  The only bad thing with the bison burgers are that they fall apart a little more easily.  Otherwise they have a wide variety of combinations for their burgers and are definitely worth checking out for a weekday lunch in the area.

What can I say...its midtown.   Ted's Montana grill is just another chain restaurant with a little bit of a twist-- buffalo meat-- but still has the feeling and the taste of a Fridays, Houlihans or Fuddruckers.Its "ok".

Full on 5 stars for Ted's.  Others who review this place below average are stupid, but hey, that's not their fault, right?  First of all, have you been outside on the street during lunch time in midtown Manhattan?  Yes?  See a lot of people?  Hey, that explains the crowd in the restaurant!  An idea -- try this place at night or on a weekend.  Next, the food is extremely high-quality and for a Manhattan sit down restaurant, it's downright cheap.First they start you off with free pickle chips that are both addictive and refillable at no charge.  Yes, the onion rings are awesome, sub for them if you can.  The bison burgers and chicken grill sandwiches are amazing.  Always juicy and hot.  The servers I've had here are attentive and friendly.  The only change I've noticed in recent months is that they've removed most of the huge selection of condiments they used to have at every table.  If you ask for them however, they will still supply them.  Other than that, its location could be more convenient in a more residential area, but they are going after that business and lunch crowd.  Ted, how about another location in the city?

More like Ted's bogus journey.  I give this place 2 stars because the waiter and hostess were so nice to our kids.  The food, however, was not so nice.  Too many other great choices nearby (The Capital Grille, Ruth's Chris) to waste time and money at Ted's.

If I had written this review of Ted's prior to my most recent visit, I'd have no trouble offering a solid 4 star rating.And the many positives of my previous visits remain present: friendly and attentive staff, a comfortable interior that captures an element of the wild west of Montana and concrete efforts at sustainable dining (Recycled paper straws, for example)The menu changed since my previous visit and a fan favorite such as the blue plate special of chicken friend chicken is no more.Now they will offer you a chicken fried chicken sandwich but isn't quite the same. In fact, the blue plate special concept has been scrapped with variations of those plates now available on a regular basis.Menu quibbles aside, what results in the 3 star rating was the quality of the food. We started with sliders, all three of them, and they arrived quickly and not exactly medium. Pink and rare was not how we requested the sliders but that is how they were delivered.Next up was a pulled pork entree that was high on salt and low on taste (besides the taste of salt). The other entree was bison meatloaf served with mashed potatoes that was acceptable, if presented in almost record time. We were still finishing up the sliders when the entrees arrived. Move 'em in, move em' out!The availability of bison meat is one of the draws of Ted's and having had the bison meatloaf and bison burger, I can comment that the meat is sweeter than it's beefier counterpart. It's allegedly healthier too as the lower calorie count on the menu indicates.Dessert offerings include fresh baked cookies and strawberry shortcake. The shortcake is worthy of the 4th star, a tower of three shortcakes and two scoops of ice cream and cream. Large enough for two to share or one to pig out on, the shortcake is highly recommended.I genuinely like Ted's and will dine there again. If it wasn't for the slight turn south in quality, I'd have no qualms about a 4th star. I'm hoping that next time the 4th star can be claimed and my present review, revised.
It was ok.  Food was ok.  Service wasn't that great.  Polite but not that friendly.  I expected it to be better.

We were SO looking forward to going to Ted's in New York, after having such a good time at the Ted's in Atlanta a few years ago. Imagine our letdown when the experience proved to be only ho-hum.Good thing: the bar has hooks for purses. I love that!First off, our waitress refused our polite request to take our photo. Minor, but we all just scratched our heads and said, O-Kaaaaaaaaay.I asked for a side of ranch, and it never came. Refills of water never came. Side dishes looked slapped onto the plates like we were at an automat (nothing against automats, but we weren't paying automat prices).Note to self: I would have felt less gypped if I'd gone to Tad's Steakhouse instead of Ted's Montana Grill.

Lean Bison? Not here. Great onion rings, but the bar...This is a 2.5 stars reviewCame here for a year-end lunch on my company tab (that's always a good thing). The place is crowded as heck on a weekday during lunch. You're sitting almost elbow to elbow w/ neighboring tables. The waiters offer to hang our jackets to make a little more room. Had the onion rings for appetizer, they are huge and delicious. Try to order a Malibu Cranberry, and the waiter came back and said that they don't have malibu. That's the ding of .5 star. I should have tested them and asked for a mojito (and see if they had mint), but I didn't.After the drinks order, I decided on a Bison strip steak, medium rare. They are about $10 more than regular steak, but I had to try it (again, not on bill, so why not?). Waited about 30 minutes, out came a decent size steak that you really can't tell if its really a buffalo. I expected a really lean, dry meat, but instead got a decently juicy, yet, extremely fatty steak. It definitely taste different than a regular steak, but that could have been psychological (you want to believe you're eating something else when they tell you its something else). The steak was cooked as requested, which was good, but still, at the end of the day, if its not healthy for you (and it wasn't), then why the heck would you pay more for it when it doesn't taste as good as the real thing? Skip this place, there's too many other fancy and much better restaurants on this block, unless you're a die hard onion rings fan.

I got lunch here with 4 of my coworkers today.  It was in honor of our intern, Ted, and his internship coming to an end.  I had a bison burger cooked medium with american cheese, french fries and a water to drink.  $13.79 + tax and tip.Photo - static.px.yelp.com/photo…

After reading all of the reviews, I noticed a lot of "3" star ratings, which to me mean you need to judge for yourself.  The food overall is fine; however, for the price I would have expected the portions to be a little larger.  The meal started-off with some half-sours prior to our order being taken and they were enjoyable.  The appetizer of crab cake was wonderful.  If you enjoy crab, I recommend ordering it and or a meal of the crab cakes (next time when I'm back).  The bison meatloaf was good with some nice texture and spice; however, the two pieces seemed small.  The other meal was the bison pot-roast, which was fine; however, it was small as well.  The garlic mash-potatoes were nice with a white pepper spice giving them a good kick.  The platters also had fresh string beans and fresh baked bread.If you're looking for a nice clean place (the bathroom was spotless) with good food in mid-town, Ted's is a good choice.

Bison burgers...  YUMMY!  ...meat like butta...  Speaking of butter, mmmmm... buns soakeeed in butter = a nice treat.Pretty empty on a weeknight... Definitely an older crowd.  But that makes it a great place for conversation, yes?Very unexpected -- LOVE that the place is eco-friendly.  Cardboard straws?  Check.  Powdered soap in the lavatory?  Check.  Up-flush for a #1, Down-flush for a #2?  Check. Had to take off a star because the waitress messed up several of our orders.  Maybe I shouldn't though, because between 6 girls who were all eyeing the calories posted on the menu, we gave her a pretty hard time.Overall, a decent pick for a low-key midtown dinner.

I was impressed that all the burgers could be made with a veggie patty, which wasn't microwaved!  Mine came with cheddar cheese and a side of fries (skip the fries, they were room temperature and bland).  Friendly, helpful staff.

Met a friend at Ted's for dinner on August 11, 2008.  I ate the bison burger and really liked it.  Now I eyeball other large mammals for potential burger consumption.  The fries were tiny and cooled quickly, but I got a lot of food and the prices weren't bad.Our server recognized we were having a conversation, so she gave us plenty of privacy.  She did a fine job checking up on us, but not so much as to be annoying.The only quibble would be that the AC was turned up higher than needed.  (Maybe that contributed to the hyper-cooling of my fries.)Heartily recommend Ted's to your favorite carnivore.

I came here for lunch based on the recommendation of a friend who worked there. I had quite a good experience and the food was pretty tasty. I got the Clam Chowder to start off with. It was a decent clam chowder, especially for a non-seafood establishment.Then I got the Bison Cadillac burger, medium rare. Basically a burger with BBQ, bacon, and cheese. I also substituted my fries for some onion rings. The burger was really nice and tender. I loved flavor and the meat was really tender and juicy. The onion rings were good as well.

Ted's is an enigma.  They have a great looking interior, a clean if not antiseptic bathroom, nice ambiance and a courteous staff and somewhat decent prices for a genre steakhouse.  But the food sucks.  It's salty or bland but always cool to cold. If the Corporation spent some money on making an interesting menu cooked more professionally then they would have a hit.    So what did I order?  Chili and Salad, Onion Rings and a Iced Coffee.

Our server was quick and efficient but he didn't make up for the food. He recommend their burgers so we both tried a bison burger. The meat was tasty and a lot more lean then a beef burger but I have had better burgers at Barney's in SF/Berkeley.

I decided to be a bit adventurous after the waitress pressured our group into trying the bison.  I have to admit my bison burger was really good, and so were the fries.  However, the service was a little sketch.  Not really somewhere I'd go out of my way to go to...but at least I can say I've eaten bison? (I think it freaks me out because I keep picturing the animal when you say "bison", but when you say "beef" I don't really picture the actual cow in my head).

A real good burger and I heard the bison burger was also good.  Got half fries, that were good, and half onion rings, that were really good.The service was definitely poor at best.  Just an overall bad waitstaff.  I don't know if they're just constantly stretched thin, but everything takes too long to get from seemingly unnattentive waiters.  The same goes for the bartenders, although one was an absolute dime.Never had any bad food here, but I'm through with the place.  Considering the service and price, there are much better places in the area to hit up.

Last night, the Man Friend and I were headed to Ben Benson's for a special occasion dinner (after failing to make Peter Luger reservations early enough... oops!), but when we peeked in the window, the restaurant looked really old people-y.  So we decided to try our luck elsewhere, and when we passed by Ted's Montana Grill, we decided to give it a try.I liked the ambience a lot-- it wasn't uptight or stuffy, but it wasn't like stepping into an Applebee's, either.  Our waiter was really nice, although the service was a bit slow (but hey, it's not fast food).  We both opted for the Kansas City strip (bison, of course, the restaurant's specialty).  My steak was kind of fatty, but once I carved away the fat, it was really juicy and delicious, albeit much firmer and denser than regular beef.  Everything was seasoned perfectly, and even my baked potato and the dinner rolls were delicious.  This seems like a great place to take visiting Midwestern parents.  All in all, it was a very enjoyable meal!

Whoever hires the wait staff at Ted' should find another job. I've eaten here about 8 times in the last year. The food is always pretty good.  If you're a seasoned NYC restaurant go-er you will be completely insulted by the way the wait staff treats you.  There's nothing worse then going to eat at a NYC restaurant and having a waiter try and get over on you. I've been treated like some dumb tourist  almost every time I come here. This kind of service seems to be a trend in midtown.

For a pre-theater dinner, head to Ted's Montana Grill, located just outside of all the Times Square hullabaloo but still close to all the Broadway shows. While this restaurant from Ted Turner is a chain, it has a unique feel.  The buffalo heads on the walls create a down-home Western atmosphere...it's quite relaxing at Ted's Montana Grill.  The servers are very friendly and not overly intrusive.  The meals are very reasonable priced for steak and chicken.  It's a great place to take any visitors who are coming into the city to have dinner with you.  You can have a good meal in a not-too-crowded New York restaurant.

NYC has plenty of places for great burgers, but this joint hits the spot with the option of bison instead of beef.  The meat is lean and tender with a subtle flavor that makes this place worthwhile for a quick lunch once you're seated.  You may want to hold out on the starches, such as chilli cheese fries, because you'll get an ample serving with your burgers.

I was walking uptown, girlfriend got real hungry so I was like, "Hey now, let us stop here, at Ted's." I have passed this restaurant a couple of times, and definitely wanted to hop in and see what it was like in there. It always looked like a good time with all the families. So we went in. I liken the atmosphere to something like Houston's mixed with The Cheesecake Factory. Frankly, the decor was that of a concept that could be thrown all over the country and taken public. Ted?I had the beer chicken and the lady had a beef burger. Regardless of the fact that she was majorly hungry, she ate the whole dang thing. Including practically all the fries. She never does that. I ate my whole chicken and all my onion rings. My chicken was a little dry, but I kind of expected it not to be totally 100%. The onion rings were real good though. The waiter was quite attentive.One discrepancy. Since I am not a billionaire, I normally look for prices on menus. So I see that if you order the onion ring appetizer, you get 10 for $8 bucks. HOWEVER, if you order two sides, 5 onion rings each, it is $6 total...$3 each. Do the math.

Even though we were in no rush, service was still painfully slow and uncoordinated. We had two waiters for our large party of 16, but service was slow, they messed up an order, and it just took forever to get additional drinks, etc.The food was fine - nothing spectacular but the prices are very reasonable for midtown. Bison is leaner than traditional beef and the taste is a bit different.This time around I ordered a chicken sandiwch with swiss cheese and mushrooms. Very taste. The reason it was so tasty was that the bread was practically coated in butter. The secret to deliciousness is butter.

The environment is important to Ted Turner so the wait staff will ask you if you want to use a straw.  If you do, you will receive a paper straw.  The take out utensils and boxes are made of corn instead of plastic.  I have a hard time picturing that.  And if you're gonna slaughter living creatures, you should do it the Ted Turner way, and not freeze it.  You should ship it fresh and have them grind it at that restaurant.  Hell, why not have bison roaming through midtown and have patrons kill their own with an arrow?I'm not on a high horse.  I had a chicken sandwich.  I just think it's funny how they were bragging.Oh, and some idiot girls stole a bunch of gift cards during the grand opening so an entire batch got deactivated.  Guess who had one of the gift cards?  Me.  How?  I got it in a gift bag from a party.  How do I know it had nothing on it?  I tried to use it and they told me that it was empty and I told them it was 10 bucks and they told me the story of the idiot girls.  In my mind, good customer service would be to take five bucks off my bill because I didn't know about the thievery.  However, that didn't happen.  Still, it was cheap--40 bucks for two meals?  And one of them involved fresh meat!

Let's call this review Close Encounters of 3 Kinds at Ted's Montana Grill.Close Encounter #1 - When it first opened last year I was thinking what balls Ted Turner has to open his bison burger saloon right next to Cite and across the street from Heartland Brewery. But that's Teddy media mogul mentality...you lay down cable and I'll launch CNN and TBS...you open an upscale and a downscale burgers/meat joint and I'll plop my rootin tootin grill smack in the middle of both of you. Eat it! On my first visit, I guess they were still trying to get their act together...the service was friendly but discombobulated...my medium-rare bison burger was medium toast...they were giving everyone free chocolate brownie ala mode to divert your attention from the mess they made...oh, the homemade lemonade was pretty refreshing...I'll give them one more chance...Close Encounter #2 - fast forward month later...I took a client there for an early lunch around noon and my timing was impeccable! Ted himself was there eating lunch at the table next to us. 60 Minutes was just in there filming a piece on him, so he decided to stay and enjoy his own grub. I guess the wait staff really had to kick their game up in front of Ted...which was good for us too. This time around my bison burger was superb - it tasted fresh off the ranch and really hit the spot. It was also fun watching Ted walking around the restaurant shaking hands, kissing babies, and signing napkins. That guy will do anything for attention. Close Encounter #3 - I call this encounter "The G-String Incident." A friend of mine emailed me a bunch of $10 gift certificate coupons off the purchase of two lunch or dinner entrees at Ted's (5 year anniversary promotion)...I figured why not use 'em so I took a colleague to lunch there the other day. We wanted to go gonzo and sat at the bar top tables where you get box seats to all the kitchen action...the grill-meisters multitasking with their tools and waiters speedily gathering up their orders....it's inspiring stuff for a foodie. All of a sudden, these two middle-aged women sit down on the stools at the next table with their backs to us. This is when things went terribly wrong...Let me start out by saying that I absolutely love when an attractive woman has on a pair of low-riding jeans with a sexy g-string showing a hint of visibility...But this one woman sat down and I swear it was like looking at a the butt of a plumber trying to fix the leak under your sink...and wearing a g-string too!!...Why do some middle-ages women dress completely inappropriately for their age and body type? Don't bother, I know the answer...Anyway, I digress from the review...I decided to skip the buffalo ride this time and ordered a grilled chicken sandwich with Monterrey Jack cheese melted on it and fries...my friend ordered some salmon dish.I give the the meal a B- for taste and chew ability, a C+ for the service (friendly but slow), an A for the price (w/ the coupon $22)...and an F- for the side show. BTW, I heard that Cite is closing. The end of a culinary era. Damn you Ted!

Even though I'm not a big fan of red meat, I love this place. I've been twice for lunch, and the service was great both times. I had the salad topped with ground bison and vinaigrette, and the pecan encrusted trout. I'm a matchbook collector and sadly, according to my waiter, Ted doesn't believe in them so you won't be able to take any Montana Grill matchbooks as souveneirs.

Went here with my family. Got me the burger that has bleu cheese. Also said bacon and mushrooms on the menu but never got them. I guess you have to ask for them??? Burger was cooked right but the meat lacked flavor. Also with the bleu cheese the burger was salty. I'd rather eat a burger somewhere else.

Went here last Friday for lunch.  OK food and atmosphere, great service, but only 3 stars because: 1) Bison Burger was decent but pricey - Got the Bison George's Cadillac Burger.  Bison is supposedly healthy for you, and it was pretty tasty.  But, for the price you pay for a burger (over $10), it's expensive and outweighs the health benefits. 2) Fries were not spectacular3) Tablecloth was still a little stained from the last table 4) Atmosphere - Definitely a guy's kind of place.  Dark lighting, wood paneling, buffalo heads hanging around the ceiling, etc.  Also pretty loud. BUT, we did see Jane Fonda sitting at one of the tables!  Funny, because she and Ted Turner got divorced in 2001.  Maybe they're still friends.
